org.pikater.web.vaadin.gui.client.kineticengine.graph

Class EdgeGraphItemClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pikater.web.vaadin.gui.client.kineticengine.graph.AbstractGraphItemClient<KineticEdgeSettings>
      • org.pikater.web.vaadin.gui.client.kineticengine.graph.EdgeGraphItemClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IKineticShapeWrapper

    public class EdgeGraphItemClient
extends AbstractGraphItemClient<KineticEdgeSettings>
    The class representing an edge in our KineticEngine.
    Author:
    SkyCrawl

      • setRegisteredInKinetic

        protected void setRegisteredInKinetic(boolean registered)
        Description copied from class: AbstractGraphItemClient
        If to be registered, the item is guaranteed not to be selected or registered. Otherwise, it is guaranteed to be registered and not to be selected.

        TIPS:
        • Access the environment using the AbstractGraphItemClient.getKineticEngine() method.
        • Use the KineticEngine.getContainer(EngineComponent engineComponent) method to access the right kinetic container.
        • Register the item with the net.edzard.kinetic.Container#add() method.
        Specified by:
        setRegisteredInKinetic in class AbstractGraphItemClient<KineticEdgeSettings>

      • destroyInnerNodes

        protected void destroyInnerNodes()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGraphItemClient
        Method to permanently destroy all inner nodes that make up this item. This method needs to do nothing else than what it states.
        Specified by:
        destroyInnerNodes in class AbstractGraphItemClient<KineticEdgeSettings>

      • updateEdge

        public void updateEdge()
        Recomputes the arrow path. If changes are to be visible in the kinetic environment, the KineticEngine.draw(EngineComponent component) needs to be called.
